data.title: Hans Grundig "Strike". 1930. Hans Grundig1901 Dresden - …
data.meta_description:
Hans Grundig "Strike". 1930.
Hans Grundig1901 Dresden - 1958 ibid.

Linocut. Unsigned, posthumous print. Inscribed and dated in lead by the artist's widow Lea Grundig on the lower right "Hans Grundig".
WVZ Bernhardt D 6.
At the upper leftcorner slightly creased.Slightly creased at the upper left corner. A few minimal tears (ca. 0,5 cm) at the margins. Waterstains at right and left margin. 
 Dimensions: pl. 31.9 x 20.5 cm, sheet 57 x 44.5 cm. 
 
 Hans Grundig
1901 Dresden - 1958 ibid.
Dresden painter and graphic artist. Apprenticeship as a decorative painter with his father. 1915-19 studies in Dresden. 1920/21 Dresden School of Arts and Crafts under Max Frey. 1921-26 studies at the Dresden academy of arts under O. Gussmann and O. Hettner. 1926 joins the KPD. 1928 marries Lea Langer - both founding members of the Dresden Association of Revolutionary Visual Artists. From 1934 he was banned from working, in 1937 some of his works were defamed as "degenerate" and partly confiscated. Exhibition ban, 1940-44 Sachsenhausen concentration camp, 1944 with the Soviet army. 1946 return to Dresden. 1947/48 professor a. rector of the Hochschule für Bildende Künste Dresden.
